meanings.sent1: The precursory signs of autumn were the first leaves changing color.
meanings.sent2: Her precursory speech hinted at the upcoming changes in the company.
meanings.sent3: The precursory chirping of birds in the morning signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent4: The precursory clouds gathering in the sky warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The precursory smell of rain made everyone reach for their umbrellas.

meanings.definition: Indicating something that will happen in the future
meanings.sent1: The precursory dark clouds suggested a storm was on the way.
meanings.sent2: His precursory remarks about the project hinted at its success.
meanings.sent3: The precursory rumble of thunder made the children excited for the rain.
meanings.sent4: The precursory silence in the room foreshadowed an important announcement.
meanings.sent5: The precursory smell of baking cookies filled the house with anticipation.

meanings.definition: Introducing or preparing for something else
meanings.sent1: The precursory meeting set the stage for the main event.
meanings.sent2: Her precursory email outlined the topics to be discussed in the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The precursory music before the movie built up the audience's excitement.
meanings.sent4: The precursory appetizers at the party whetted everyone's appetite.
meanings.sent5: The precursory decorations in the room hinted at the theme of the party.
